Receipt for 1844 City of Springfield Taxes, September 18441 CITY OFSPRINGFIELD,Sep1844. ReceivedofA. LincolnSix56/100Dollars, in full for his City Tax, for the year 1844, on the following described property,

to-wit:
paragraphs: Receipt for 1844 City of Springfield Taxes, September 18441 CITY OFSPRINGFIELD,Sep1844. ReceivedofA. LincolnSix56/100Dollars, in full for his City Tax, for the year 1844, on the following described property,
citations: Deed of Elijah Iles and Malinda Iles to Abraham Lincoln.
Deed of Charles Dresser and Louisa W. Dresser to Abraham Lincoln.

footnotes.text: 1Nicholas A. Garland filled in the blanks of this partially-printed document.

2Abraham Lincoln purchased these two lots from Elijah Iles in 1838 for $300. The lots
                  were in the middle of the block across Eighth Street from his home.Deed of Elijah Iles and Malinda Iles to Abraham Lincoln.

3This property was Lincolnâ€™s home at Eighth and Jackson streets in Springfield, which
                  he purchased fromCharles Dresserin May 1844.Deed of Charles Dresser and Louisa W. Dresser to Abraham Lincoln.
